author: dy_enforcer
title: A Tamed Rahi
review:
Well I have nothing to say about this small rahi.But I guess I'll just have to review it.Thulox is a hydruka from mahri nui that is tamed by the matoran.Its design is very simple but no new pieces,just some recycled ones.Also they use nuparu inika claws for their mouth and rahkshi head for their head.And of course a zamor launcher or should I say SOLIDIFIED AIR BUBBLES.

Pros:

-A very well-design rahi
-zamo-um I mean Solidified air bubbles can really fire

Cons:

-No new pieces
-A recycled zamor launcher
-hard to pose because of the H design of the rahi

Overall: 3(5/10)A nice hydruka look but with recycled pieces its actually a downfall.At least its only a cheap price so whether you buy it or not.It's up to you.

author: Gus_263
title: The red Hydruka
review: The Hydruka of 2007 are good builted, but small and with no mask. Thulox have a awesome color combination and a nice building. This set is not much playable, but it have reasons to be not much playable, because Thulox is a a rahi. The mouth is an feature that the Hydruka Morak also have, and the mouth do a good effect on the set. The tail is like the legs not playable but it have an sphere launcher, that works very well and do the set be more cool to play with. Unfortunately, this set do not have a great feature, mask and good playability (yes, it is a rahi, but some small sets are more playable). Due to this, i rate Thulox overall 4/5

author: legoguy_3000_
title: my second hydruka
review:
A very good set. This was my second hydruka. thulox has a solified air bubble launcher and that is strange because small sets don't normally have a launcher.

pros:
cool teeth
cool mask
solified air bubble launcher really fires

cons:
no eyes

I think this set is really cool 4/5

author: BionicleBOOM
title: Great Rahi!!
review:
I got Thulox to go with Morak, and I wasn't disappointed!  He is actually dual colored, his frontside being red and his backside being black.  The tail-mounted air bubble launcher is a nice touch, as well as the teeth.  He is very posable and playable.  Pros and Cons:

Pros:

-Dual-colored

-Teeth

-Air bubble launcher (Zamor launcher)

-Posable

-Playable

Cons:

-None!!

Thulox is a good buy!!  Great set!!

author: KennyD99
title: So/So
review:
I don't like Bioncle but I got this for my birthday. 
Thulox looks cool, but the build is boring. The zamor sphere shooter is cool and I like the teeth.

Pros: Zamor sphere shooter
Teeth
Moving limbs
Double color

Cons:
boring build

author: Nth_Brick
title: Kind of cute...
review:
Before I write this, let me clear up that I do not actually own this set.  However, my brother bought, like three of these things so, I have played with them before.

 

This really is a pretty decent little set.  It comes with some pretty nice claw pieces that are great for MOCs and the air bubble launcher can be used on pretty much any Bionicle and look great.  The build itself is okay as I remember.  It mainly consisted of just attaching the limbs to the body.  Nothing special but, it makes it more fun for a kid ot play with.  Before you go after me about the title, think about the story of these things.  They are tamed Rahi that the Matoran of Mahri Nui used to gather air bubbles to keep themselves alive.  I just have a picture in my head of a Matoran and his faithful, little Hydruka.  Anyway, aside from the claws and ball launcher, there is nothing very unique.  Still, he is a fun enough toy that any kid would have fun with on a trip or something.  And, for only $5 US when it came out, it was a good value and you could most likely get one fairly cheap off Amazon or eBay.

 

Thanks for reading,

 

Blockman
